message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.CY, cs.CR

This paper deals with automated detection of hate speech in online social networks, which involves natural language processing and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves the use of embeddings and classification methods, which are relevant to sub-categories such as cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing). The paper also discusses the societal impact of hate speech, which could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
